alert.note: Alert for Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 19 at 4:39PM MST until February 21 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts around 60 mph. Local gusts up to 70 mph possible along Wyoming Boulevard on the south side of Casper. Peak gusts over the higher terrain of the Green and Rattlesnake Mountains could reach 75 mph. * WHERE...Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range and Natrona County Lower Elevations. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Strong wind gusts will blow around loose objects. Blowing snow is possible, which may result in locally reduced visibility. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles traveling Wyoming Boulevard. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest wind gusts are likely to occur between midnight and 12 noon Tuesday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations
